content.description:
One of the longer routes, can lots of snow can be a challenge between the lower pitch of ice and upper pitches.

km 3.6 on the logging road, this is the longer of the routes seen when looking across the creek at the ice.
Ice protection and trees.

climbs.name: Cosmic Disco Party
climbs.fa: Jonus Lecuyer and Andy Lecuyer January 2018

content.description:
Short technical pillar leading up to snow ramp above. 40 km east of terrace park on side of road on the west side of a creek. You will head up an old logging road through a recently logged pine flat. In a short distance you will begin gaining elevation. At approximately 2 km you will gain your first view of some ice across the valley. These routes are best approached from by parking on the east side of little Oliver creek. Keep sking the valley and many more will appear.

Cosmic Disco party is 10 feet to the right of Groove Tube. This will be on the right hand side of the the valley between 2 and 3 km. Ski past rock cut on road to its end. Look up snow cone and follow flagging up to route. It was flagged in 2019 with orange and black flagging tape.

PARKING FOR LITTLE OLIVER
N54 47.876 W128 16.459
ELEVATION 430’ Ice and trees above

The Route climbs up a groove which becomes a chimney after a few moves, climb out of chimney to a short steep step which leads up to the pillar of ice above. 40 km east of terrace park on side of road on the west side of a creek. You will head up an old logging road through a recently logged pine flat. In a short distance you will begin gaining elevation. At approximately 2 km you will gain your first view of some ice across the valley. These routes are best approached from by parking on the east side of little Oliver creek. Keep sking the valley and many more will appear.

Groove Tube will be on the right hand side of the the valley between 2 and 3 km. Ski past rock cut on road to its end. Look up snow cone and follow flagging up to route. It was flagged in 2019 with orange and black flagging tape.

PARKING FOR LITTLE OLIVER
N54 47.876 W128 16.459
ELEVATION 430’ Ice protection with tree anchors.

Three pitch route with amazing features. The last pitch you can make it through the roof quite easily on the right side M5. Bolts have been added to route in 2019 so  you can climb in lean conditions.

N54 48.473 W128 15.570

ELEVATION 1055’

Ski and or snow shoe up valley from East side of creek, best to look at ice from the logging road prior to looking for routes.
Ice protection and bolts.

climbs.name: Hot Stuff
climbs.fa: Gary Mcquaid, Andy Lecuyer and Laurent Janssen, 2017

content.description:
Climb steep corner with sparse gear up to steep snow ramp that leads up to the last pitch of Hobgoblin.

Just left of Hobgoblin.
Rock protection and ice protection.

climbs.name: Java Monster
climbs.fa: Scott Garvin, and Andy Lecuyer Feb 2009

content.description:
This is one of the best routes in the valley by far. Great position, great climbing, and one of the easiest routes to get to. On the east side of the valley. P1 50m W4+ steep pillar that narrows through a constriction leads to a snow/ice slope above P2 short W4 M5 takes you over a car sized chock stone. Climb past the chock stone on the right M5 or left burly steep moves M6 P3 easier ground snow slopes/ice up to bend in gulley. Belay on trees left side P4 climb snow slope up to short brittle pillar of ice, climb 15 meters higher to trees on left. P5 50m W3 sweet moves in a narrow ice fillled gulley belay tucked away on the left side of the last pitch. P6 40m W5 finish up the apron to a short technical pillar of ice. 54°48'43.96"N128°14'37.00"W 54°48'43.96"N128°14'37.00"W
Ski up road to 3 km and cross creek to east side of valley. The pillar is the closest piece of ice you can see.  Ice protection, with some rock gear for pitch 2.

climbs.name: Mean Bean
climbs.fa: Scott Garvin, Andy Lecuyer and Phillip Grant, Feb 2009

content.description:
P1 Steep pillar IV
P2 III upper pitches above many option



Ski up west side approach up logging road to 3km and cross creek, make your way up to ice above. It is the largest volume of ice that tops out at the tree line.
Ice protection and trees

climbs.name: One Fierce Beer Coaster
climbs.fa: Gary Mcquaid, Scott Garvin and Andy Lecuyer 2008

content.description:
Gulley climb just right of the Ice Palace
The start of the route begins at a junction where two ice flows meet. The right gully is One Fierce Beer Coaster. The left route is where you can climb Ice Palace a W3 route that takes you directly to the Official Ice palace.

N54°48'45.62"W128°14'29.82"
Ice protection

Crossing the creek can be the crux.

Ski 3.3 km up road and cross creek this is one of three lines in close proximity to each other.
Ice screws

Great line that does have avalanche concerns in the right conditions from the gully above. It looks like there may be more ice to climb 200 meters higher than where we typically rap down. If the pillar is lean you can climb up to the base in one pitch and trend up and left through ice flows on the left.  3 km on the road. When you get to the sign you will have a great view of the ice on the east side of the valley. Popsicle Pete’s pillar is found by hiking up the slope for about five minutes on the west side of the road. The pillar can be seen after a couple of minutes of hiking up the slope.
54°48'27.39"N128°14'39.65"W Ice protection and trees.

climbs.name: Screaming Piss Clams
climbs.fa: Gary Mcquaid, Andy Lecuyer and Jason Weich Feb 2017

content.description:
P1 IV ice pillar up to bolt belay
P2 M6 up interesting ice and rock past bolts to bolt belay
P3 IV Traverse out past belay to snow ledge and up ice curtain above

Follow route description for East side approach of creek.
Ice protection and bolts.

climbs.name: The Shawdow
climbs.fa: Gary Mcquaid, Andy Lecuyer and Felix 2008

content.description:
Pick the right gully on the west side of the valley and start climbing up to the base approximately ½ hour 45 minutes to base. The right side of the route is capped by an impressive overhanging wall that almost turns the first pitch into a cave. The second pitch climbs steeply off the belay to a ramp of low grade ice/snow. The finally has some options, steep pillar on the right or steep treed grove on the left.

N54°48'51.84"W128°14'22.13"
Ice Screws

Crossing the creek can be a challenge at times.

3.7 km up logging road.
Ice protection and gear.

Pitch one climb up ramp of snow to a left trending ramp up to tree belay on ledge. 
Pitch two climb through icicles and ledges to below ice curtain above.
Pitch three climb up steep ice curtain to tree belay.

Approach route on east side of creek description in found in main area.
Ice protection and trees.
Awesome valley for the area with lots of options for Ice. Options to access include skis, and or snow shoes.
